name: mat_reloadmaterial

name: mat_reloadtextures

name: mat_reset_rendertargets
desc: Resets all the render targets

name: mat_savechanges

name: mat_setvideomode

name: mat_shadercount
desc: display count of all shaders and reset that count

name: mat_show_ab_hdr_hudelement

name: mat_show_texture_memory_usage
desc: Display the texture memory usage on the HUD.

name: mat_showmaterials
desc: Show materials.

name: mat_showmaterialsverbose
desc: Show materials (verbose version).

name: mat_showmiplevels
desc: color-code miplevels 2: normalmaps, 1: everything else

name: mat_showtextures
desc: Show used textures.

name: mat_software_aa_edge_threshold

name: mat_software_aa_quality

name: mat_software_aa_strength_vgui

name: mat_software_aa_tap_offset
desc: Software AA - adjusts the displacement of the taps used by the software AA shader (default 1.0 - a lower value will make the image sharper, higher will make it blurrier)

name: mat_specular
desc: Enable/Disable specularity for perf testing.  Will cause a material reload upon change.

name: mat_spew_on_texture_size

name: mat_spewvertexandpixelshaders
desc: Print all vertex and pixel shaders currently loaded to the console

name: mat_texture_limit
desc: If this value is not -1, the material system will limit the amount of texture memory it uses in a frame. Useful for identifying performance cliffs. The value is in kilobytes.

name: mat_texture_list
desc: For debugging, show a list of used textures per frame

name: mat_texture_list_all
desc: If this is nonzero, then the texture list panel will show all currently-loaded textures.

name: mat_texture_list_content_path
desc: The content path to the materialsrc directory. If left unset, it'll assume your content directory is next to the currently running game dir.

name: mat_texture_list_txlod
desc: Adjust LOD of the last viewed texture +1 to inc resolution, -1 to dec resolution

name: mat_texture_list_txlod_sync
desc: 'reset' - resets all run-time changes to LOD overrides, 'save' - saves all changes to material content files

name: mat_texture_list_view
desc: If this is nonzero, then the texture list panel will render thumbnails of currently-loaded textures.

name: mat_texture_outline_fonts
desc: Outline fonts textures.

name: mat_texture_reload_frame_swap_workaround
desc: Workaround certain GL drivers holding unnecessary amounts of data when loading many materials by forcing synthetic frame swaps

name: mat_texture_save_fonts
desc: Save all font textures

name: mat_tonemap_algorithm
desc: 0 = Original Algorithm 1 = New Algorithm

name: mat_viewportscale
desc: Scale down the main viewport (to reduce GPU impact on CPU profiling)

name: mat_viewportupscale
desc: Scale the viewport back up

name: mat_vsync
desc: Force sync to vertical retrace

name: matchmakingport
desc: Host Matchmaking port

name: maxplayers

name: mem_max_heapsize_dedicated

name: mem_min_heapsize

name: mem_periodicdumps

name: mem_test_each_frame

name: mem_test_every_n_seconds

name: mem_vcollide
desc: Dumps the memory used by vcollides

name: memory
desc: Print memory stats.

name: memory_diff
desc: show memory stats relative to snapshot

name: memory_list
desc: dump memory list (linux only)

name: memory_mark
desc: snapshot current allocation status

name: memory_status
desc: show memory stats (linux only)

name: menuselect
desc: menuselect

name: minisave
desc: Saves game (for current level only!)

name: mission_list
desc: List all available tactical missions

name: mission_show
desc: Show the given mission

name: mm_add_item
desc: Add a stats item

name: mm_add_player
desc: Add a player

name: mm_max_spectators
desc: Max players allowed on the spectator team

name: mm_message
desc: Send a message to all remote clients

name: mm_minplayers
desc: Number of players required to start an unranked game

name: mm_select_session
desc: Select a session

name: mm_session_info
desc: Dump session information

name: mod_forcedata

name: mod_forcetouchdata
desc: Forces all model file data into cache on model load.

name: mod_load_fakestall
desc: Forces all ANI file loading to stall for specified ms

name: mod_load_showstall
desc: 1 - show hitches , 2 - show stalls

name: mod_offline_hdr_switch

name: mod_touchalldata

name: model_list
desc: Dump model list to file

name: motdfile

name: motdfile_text
desc: The text-only MOTD file to use for clients that have disabled HTML MOTDs.

name: movie_fixwave

name: mp_bonusroundtime

name: mp_chattime

name: mp_clan_readyrestart

name: mp_disable_autokick
desc: Prevents a userid from being auto-kicked

name: mp_enableroundwaittime
desc: Enable timers to wait between rounds.

name: mp_fadetoblack

name: mp_forceautoteam

name: mp_forcecamera

name: mp_forcerespawnplayers

name: mp_forcewin

name: mp_fraglimit

name: mp_friendlyfire

name: mp_highlander

name: mp_idlemaxtime

name: mp_maxrounds
desc: max number of rounds to play before server changes maps

name: mp_respawnwavetime
desc: Time between respawn waves.

name: mp_restartgame

name: mp_restartgame_immediate
desc: If non-zero, game will restart immediately

name: mp_restartround
desc: If non-zero, the current round will restart in the specified number of seconds

name: mp_scrambleteams

name: mp_showrespawntimes
desc: Show the min respawn times for the teams

name: mp_time_between_capscoring

name: mp_timelimit

name: mp_tournament_post_match_period

name: mp_tournament_readymode
desc: Enable per-player ready status for tournament mode.

name: mp_tournament_readymode_countdown

name: mp_tournament_readymode_min

name: mp_tournament_readymode_team_size

name: mp_tournament_whitelist
desc: Specifies the item whitelist file to use.

name: mp_waitingforplayers_restart

name: mp_winlimit
desc: Max score one team can reach before server changes maps

name: multvar

name: name
desc: Current user name

name: namelockid
desc: Prevent name changes for this userID.

name: nav_add_to_selected_set

name: nav_add_to_selected_set_by_id
desc: Add specified area id to the selected set.

name: nav_analyze
desc: Re-analyze the current Navigation Mesh and save it to disk.

name: nav_area_bgcolor
desc: RGBA color to draw as the background color for nav areas while editing.

name: nav_area_max_size
desc: Max area size created in nav generation

name: nav_avoid
desc: Toggles the 'avoid this area when possible' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_begin_area

name: nav_begin_deselecting
desc: Start continuously removing from the selected set.

name: nav_begin_drag_deselecting
desc: Start dragging a selection area.

name: nav_begin_drag_selecting
desc: Start dragging a selection area.

name: nav_begin_selecting
desc: Start continuously adding to the selected set.

name: nav_begin_shift_xy
desc: Begin shifting the Selected Set.

name: nav_build_ladder
desc: Attempts to build a nav ladder on the climbable surface under the cursor.

name: nav_check_file_consistency
desc: Scans the maps directory and reports any missing/out-of-date navigation files.

name: nav_check_floor
desc: Updates the blocked/unblocked status for every nav area.

name: nav_check_stairs
desc: Update the nav mesh STAIRS attribute

name: nav_chop_selected
desc: Chops all selected areas into their component 1x1 areas

name: nav_clear_attribute
desc: Remove given nav attribute from all areas in the selected set.

name: nav_clear_selected_set
desc: Clear the selected set.

name: nav_clear_walkable_marks
desc: Erase any previously placed walkable positions.

name: nav_compress_id
desc: Re-orders area and ladder ID's so they are continuous.

name: nav_corner_adjust_adjacent
desc: radius used to raise/lower corners in nearby areas when raising/lowering corners.

name: nav_corner_lower
desc: Lower the selected corner of the currently marked Area.

name: nav_corner_place_on_ground
desc: Places the selected corner of the currently marked Area on the ground.

name: nav_corner_raise
desc: Raise the selected corner of the currently marked Area.

name: nav_corner_select
desc: Select a corner of the currently marked Area. Use multiple times to access all four corners.

name: nav_create_area_at_feet
desc: Anchor nav_begin_area Z to editing player's feet

name: nav_create_place_on_ground
desc: If true, nav areas will be placed flush with the ground when created by hand.

name: nav_crouch
desc: Toggles the 'must crouch in this area' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_delete
desc: Deletes the currently highlighted Area.

name: nav_delete_marked
desc: Deletes the currently marked Area (if any).

name: nav_disconnect
desc: To disconnect two Areas, mark an Area, highlight a second Area, then invoke the disconnect command. This will remove all connections between the two Areas.

name: nav_disconnect_outgoing_oneways
desc: For each area in the selected set, disconnect all outgoing one-way connections.

name: nav_displacement_test
desc: Checks for nodes embedded in displacements (useful for in-development maps)

name: nav_dont_hide
desc: Toggles the 'area is not suitable for hiding spots' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_drag_selection_volume_zmax_offset
desc: The offset of the nav drag volume top from center

name: nav_drag_selection_volume_zmin_offset
desc: The offset of the nav drag volume bottom from center

name: nav_draw_limit
desc: The maximum number of areas to draw in edit mode

name: nav_dump_selected_set_positions
desc: Write the (x,y,z) coordinates of the centers of all selected nav areas to a file.

name: nav_edit
desc: Set to one to interactively edit the Navigation Mesh. Set to zero to leave edit mode.

name: nav_end_area
desc: Defines the second corner of a new Area or Ladder and creates it.

name: nav_end_deselecting
desc: Stop continuously removing from the selected set.

name: nav_end_drag_deselecting
desc: Stop dragging a selection area.

name: nav_end_drag_selecting
desc: Stop dragging a selection area.

name: nav_end_selecting
desc: Stop continuously adding to the selected set.

name: nav_end_shift_xy
desc: Finish shifting the Selected Set.

name: nav_flood_select
desc: Selects the current Area and all Areas connected to it, recursively. To clear a selection, use this command again.

name: nav_gen_cliffs_approx
desc: Mark cliff areas, post-processing approximation

name: nav_generate
desc: Generate a Navigation Mesh for the current map and save it to disk.

name: nav_generate_fencetops
desc: Autogenerate nav areas on fence and obstacle tops

name: nav_generate_fixup_jump_areas
desc: Convert obsolete jump areas into 2-way connections

name: nav_generate_incremental
desc: Generate a Navigation Mesh for the current map and save it to disk.

name: nav_generate_incremental_tolerance
desc: Z tolerance for adding new nav areas.

name: nav_generate_jump_connections
desc: If disabled, don't generate jump connections from jump areas

name: nav_jump
desc: Toggles the 'traverse this area by jumping' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_ladder_flip
desc: Flips the selected ladder's direction.

name: nav_load
desc: Loads the Navigation Mesh for the current map.

name: nav_lower_drag_volume_max
desc: Lower the top of the drag select volume.

name: nav_lower_drag_volume_min
desc: Lower the bottom of the drag select volume.

name: nav_make_sniper_spots
desc: Chops the marked area into disconnected sub-areas suitable for sniper spots.

name: nav_mark
desc: Marks the Area or Ladder under the cursor for manipulation by subsequent editing commands.

name: nav_mark_attribute
desc: Set nav attribute for all areas in the selected set.

name: nav_mark_unnamed
desc: Mark an Area with no Place name. Useful for finding stray areas missed when Place Painting.

name: nav_mark_walkable
desc: Mark the current location as a walkable position. These positions are used as seed locations when sampling the map to generate a Navigation Mesh.

name: nav_max_view_distance
desc: Maximum range for precomputed nav mesh visibility (0 = default 1500 units)

name: nav_merge
desc: To merge two Areas into one, mark the first Area, highlight the second by pointing your cursor at it, and invoke the merge command.

name: nav_merge_mesh
desc: Merges a saved selected set into the current mesh.

name: nav_no_hostages
desc: Toggles the 'hostages cannot use this area' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_no_jump
desc: Toggles the 'dont jump in this area' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_place_list
desc: Lists all place names used in the map.

name: nav_place_pick
desc: Sets the current Place to the Place of the Area under the cursor.

name: nav_place_replace
desc: Replaces all instances of the first place with the second place.

name: nav_place_set
desc: Sets the Place of all selected areas to the current Place.

name: nav_precise
desc: Toggles the 'dont avoid obstacles' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_quicksave
desc: Set to one to skip the time consuming phases of the analysis.  Useful for data collection and testing.

name: nav_raise_drag_volume_max
desc: Raise the top of the drag select volume.

name: nav_raise_drag_volume_min
desc: Raise the bottom of the drag select volume.

name: nav_recall_selected_set
desc: Re-selects the stored selected set.

name: nav_remove_from_selected_set
desc: Remove current area from the selected set.

name: nav_remove_jump_areas
desc: Removes legacy jump areas, replacing them with connections.

name: nav_run
desc: Toggles the 'traverse this area by running' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_save
desc: Saves the current Navigation Mesh to disk.

name: nav_save_selected
desc: Writes the selected set to disk for merging into another mesh via nav_merge_mesh.

name: nav_select_blocked_areas
desc: Adds all blocked areas to the selected set

name: nav_select_damaging_areas
desc: Adds all damaging areas to the selected set

name: nav_select_half_space
desc: Selects any areas that intersect the given half-space.

name: nav_select_invalid_areas
desc: Adds all invalid areas to the Selected Set.

name: nav_select_larger_than
desc: Select nav areas where both dimensions are larger than the given size.

name: nav_select_obstructed_areas
desc: Adds all obstructed areas to the selected set

name: nav_select_orphans
desc: Adds all orphan areas to the selected set (highlight a valid area first).

name: nav_select_overlapping
desc: Selects nav areas that are overlapping others.

name: nav_select_radius
desc: Adds all areas in a radius to the selection set

name: nav_select_stairs
desc: Adds all stairway areas to the selected set

name: nav_selected_set_border_color
desc: Color used to draw the selected set borders while editing.

name: nav_selected_set_color
desc: Color used to draw the selected set background while editing.

name: nav_set_place_mode

name: nav_shift
desc: Shifts the selected areas by the specified amount

name: nav_show_approach_points
desc: Show Approach Points in the Navigation Mesh.

name: nav_show_area_info
desc: Duration in seconds to show nav area ID and attributes while editing

name: nav_show_continguous
desc: Highlight non-contiguous connections

name: nav_show_danger
desc: Show current 'danger' levels.

name: nav_show_dumped_positions
desc: Show the (x,y,z) coordinate positions of the given dump file.

name: nav_show_func_nav_avoid
desc: Show areas of designer-placed bot avoidance due to func_nav_avoid entities

name: nav_show_func_nav_prefer
desc: Show areas of designer-placed bot preference due to func_nav_prefer entities

name: nav_show_func_nav_prerequisite
desc: Show areas of designer-placed bot preference due to func_nav_prerequisite entities

name: nav_show_player_counts
desc: Show current player counts in each area.

name: nav_show_potentially_visible
desc: Show areas that are potentially visible from the current nav area

name: nav_simplify_selected
desc: Chops all selected areas into their component 1x1 areas and re-merges them together into larger areas

name: nav_slope_limit

name: nav_slope_tolerance
desc: The ground unit normal's Z component must be this close to the nav area's Z component to be generated.

name: nav_snap_to_grid
desc: Snap to the nav generation grid when creating new nav areas

name: nav_solid_props
desc: Make props solid to nav generation/editing

name: nav_splice

name: nav_split
desc: To split an Area into two, align the split line using your cursor and invoke the split command.

name: nav_stand
desc: Toggles the 'stand while hiding' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_stop

name: nav_store_selected_set

name: nav_strip

name: nav_subdivide

name: nav_test_stairs

name: nav_toggle_deselecting

name: nav_toggle_in_selected_set
desc: Remove current area from the selected set.

name: nav_toggle_place_mode
desc: Toggle the editor into and out of Place mode. Place mode allows labelling of Area with Place names.

name: nav_toggle_place_painting

name: nav_toggle_selected_set

name: nav_toggle_selecting
desc: Start or stop continuously adding to the selected set.

name: nav_transient

name: nav_unmark
desc: Clears the marked Area or Ladder.

name: nav_update_blocked
desc: Updates the blocked/unblocked status for every nav area.

name: nav_update_lighting

name: nav_update_visibility_on_edit

name: nav_use_place

name: nav_walk
desc: Toggles the 'traverse this area by walking' flag used by the AI system.

name: nav_warp_to_mark

name: nav_world_center
desc: Centers the nav mesh in the world

name: nb_blind
desc: Disable vision

name: nb_command

name: nb_debug

name: nb_debug_filter

name: nb_debug_history

name: nb_debug_known_entities

name: nb_delete_all

name: net_maxfragments

name: replay_data_lifespan
desc: The number of days before replay data will be removed from the server.  Server operators can expect that any data written more than replay_data_lifespan days will be considered stale, and any subsequent execution of replay_docleanup (or automatic cleanup, which can be enabled with replay_fileserver_autocleanup) will remove that data.

name: replay_deathcammaxverticaloffset

desc: This is the camera length used to simulate camera shake in the replay editor.  The larger this number, the more the actual position will change.  It can also be set to negative values.

name: replay_editor_fov_mousewheel_invert
desc: Invert FOV zoom/unzoom on mousewheel in the replay editor.

name: replay_editor_fov_mousewheel_multiplier
desc: The multiplier on mousewheel input for adjusting camera FOV in the replay editor.

name: replay_enable
desc: Enable Replay recording on server

name: replay_enableeventbasedscreenshots
desc: If disabled, only take a screenshot when a replay is saved.  If enabled, take up to replay_maxscreenshotsperreplay screenshots, with a minimum of replay_mintimebetweenscreenshots seconds in between, at key events.  Events include kills, ubers (if you are a medic), sentry kills (if you are an engineer), etc.  NOTE: Turning this on may affect performance!

name: replay_enablerenderpreview
desc: Enable preview during replay render.

name: replay_fileserver_autocleanup
desc: Automatically do fileserver cleanup in between rounds?  This is the same as explicitly calling replay_docleanup.

name: replay_fileserver_host
desc: The hostname of the Web server hosting replays.  This can be an IP or a hostname, e.g. '1.2.3.4' or 'www.myserver.com'

name: replay_fileserver_offload_aborttime
desc: The time after which publishing will be aborted for a session block or session info file.

name: replay_fileserver_path
desc: If your replays are stored at 'http://123.123.123.123:4567/tf/replays', replay_fileserver_path should be set to '/tf/replays'

name: replay_fileserver_port
desc: The port for the Web server hosting replays.  For example, if your replays are stored at 'http://123.123.123.123:4567/tf/replays', replay_fileserver_port should be 4567.

name: replay_fileserver_protocol
desc: Can be 'http' or 'https'

name: replay_flushinterval
desc: Replay system will flush to disk a maximum of every replay_flushinterval seconds.

name: replay_forcereconstruct
desc: Force the reconstruction of replays each time.

name: replay_hidebrowser
desc: Hides replay browser

name: replay_max_publish_threads
desc: The max number of threads allowed for publishing replay data, e.g. FTP threads.

name: replay_maxconcurrentdownloads

name: replay_maxscreenshotsperreplay
desc: The maximum number of screenshots that can be taken for any given replay.

name: replay_mintimebetweenscreenshots

name: snd_show

name: soundlist

name: soundscape_dumpclient

name: soundscape_flush

name: speak

name: spec_freeze_distance_min

name: spec_freeze_time
desc: Time spend frozen in observer freeze cam.

name: spec_freeze_traveltime
desc: Time taken to zoom in to frame a target in observer freeze cam.

name: spec_mode

desc: Start recording movie frames.

name: status

desc: Stops all soundscape processing and fades current looping sounds

desc: Parses and stuffs command line + commands to command buffer.

name: surfaceprop
desc: Reports the surface properties at the cursor

name: sv_allow_color_correction
desc: Allow or disallow clients to use color correction on this server.

name: sv_allow_point_servercommand
desc: Allow use of point_servercommand entities in map. Potentially dangerous for untrusted maps.   disallow : Always disallow   official : Allowed for valve maps only   always   : Allow for all maps

name: sv_allow_voice_from_file
desc: Allow or disallow clients from using voice_inputfromfile on this server.

name: sv_allow_votes
desc: Allow voting?

name: sv_allow_wait_command
desc: Allow or disallow the wait command on clients connected to this server.

name: sv_allowdownload
desc: Allow clients to download files

name: sv_allowupload
desc: Allow clients to upload customizations files

name: sv_alltalk
desc: Players can hear all other players, no team restrictions

name: sv_alternateticks
desc: If set, server only simulates entities on even numbered ticks.

name: sv_autosave
desc: Set to 1 to autosave game on level transition. Does not affect autosave triggers.

name: sv_benchmark_autovprofrecord
desc: If running a benchmark and this is set, it will record a vprof file over the duration of the benchmark with filename benchmark.vprof.

name: sv_benchmark_force_start
desc: Force start the benchmark. This is only for debugging. It's better to set sv_benchmark to 1 and restart the level.

name: sv_benchmark_freeroam
desc: Allow the local player to move freely in the benchmark. Only used for debugging. Don't use for real benchmarks because it will make the timing inconsistent.

name: sv_benchmark_numticks
desc: If > 0, then it only runs the benchmark for this # of ticks.

name: sv_bonus_challenge
desc: Set to values other than 0 to select a bonus map challenge type.

name: sv_bonus_map_challenge_update
desc: Updates a bonus map challenge score.

name: sv_bonus_map_complete
desc: Completes a bonus map.

name: sv_bonus_map_unlock
desc: Locks a bonus map.

name: sv_cacheencodedents
desc: If set to 1, does an optimization to prevent extra SendTable_Encode calls.

name: sv_cheats
desc: Allow cheats on server

name: sv_clearhinthistory
desc: Clear memory of server side hints displayed to the player.

name: sv_client_cmdrate_difference

name: sv_client_max_interp_ratio
desc: This can be used to limit the value of cl_interp_ratio for connected clients (only while they are connected). If sv_client_min_interp_ratio is -1, then this cvar has no effect.

name: sv_client_min_interp_ratio
desc: This can be used to limit the value of cl_interp_ratio for connected clients (only while they are connected).               -1 = let clients set cl_interp_ratio to anything  any other value = set minimum value for cl_interp_ratio

name: sv_client_predict
desc: This can be used to force the value of cl_predict for connected clients (only while they are connected).    -1 = let clients set cl_predict to anything     0 = force cl_predict to 0     1 = force cl_predict to 1

name: sv_clockcorrection_msecs
desc: The server tries to keep each player's m_nTickBase withing this many msecs of the server absolute tickcount

name: sv_compressstringtablebaselines_threshold
desc: Minimum size (in bytes) for stringtablebaseline buffer to be compressed.

name: sv_consistency
desc: Legacy variable with no effect!  This was deleted and then added as a temporary kludge to prevent players from being banned by servers running old versions of SMAC

name: sv_contact
desc: Contact email for server sysop

name: sv_debug_player_use
desc: Visualizes +use logic. Green cross=trace success, Red cross=trace too far, Green box=radius success

name: sv_debugmanualmode
desc: Make sure entities correctly report whether or not their network data has changed.

name: sv_debugtempentities
desc: Show temp entity bandwidth usage.

name: sv_deltaprint
desc: Print accumulated CalcDelta profiling data (only if sv_deltatime is on)

name: sv_deltatime
desc: Enable profiling of CalcDelta calls

name: sv_disable_querycache
desc: debug - disable trace query cache

name: sv_downloadlist_include_navfile
desc: Include map nav files in the download list for clients.

name: sv_downloadurl
desc: Location from which clients can download missing files

name: sv_dump_edicts
desc: Display a list of edicts allocated on the server.

name: sv_enableoldqueries
desc: Enable support for old style (HL1) server queries

name: sv_filterban
desc: Set packet filtering by IP mode

name: sv_forcepreload
desc: Force server side preloading.

name: sv_gravity
desc: World gravity.

name: sv_lan
desc: Server is a lan server ( no heartbeat, no authentication, no non-class C addresses )

name: sv_log_onefile
desc: Log server information to only one file.

name: sv_logbans
desc: Log server bans in the server logs.

name: sv_logblocks
desc: If true when log when a query is blocked (can cause very large log files)

name: sv_logecho
desc: Echo log information to the console.

name: sv_logfile
desc: Log server information in the log file.

name: sv_logfilecompress
desc: Gzip compress logfile and rename to logfilename.log.gz on close.

name: sv_logfilename_format
desc: Log filename format. See strftime for formatting codes.

name: sv_logflush
desc: Flush the log file to disk on each write (slow).

name: sv_logsdir
desc: Folder in the game directory where server logs will be stored.

name: sv_logsecret
desc: If set then include this secret when doing UDP logging (will use 0x53 as packet type, not usual 0x52)

name: sv_lowedict_action
desc: 0 - no action, 1 - warn to log file, 2 - attempt to restart the game, if applicable, 3 - restart the map, 4 - go to the next map in the map cycle, 5 - spew all edicts.

name: sv_lowedict_threshold
desc: When only this many edicts are free, take the action specified by sv_lowedict_action.

name: sv_master_share_game_socket
desc: Use the game's socket to communicate to the master server. If this is 0, then it will create a socket on -steamport + 1 to communicate to the master server on.

name: sv_max_connects_sec
desc: Maximum connections per second to respond to from a single IP address.

name: sv_max_connects_sec_global
desc: Maximum connections per second to respond to from anywhere.

name: sv_max_connects_window
desc: Window over which to average connections per second averages.

name: sv_max_dropped_packets_to_process
desc: Max dropped packets to process. Lower settings prevent lagged players from simulating too far in the past. Setting of 0 disables cap.

name: sv_max_queries_sec
desc: Maximum queries per second to respond to from a single IP address.

name: sv_max_queries_sec_global
desc: Maximum queries per second to respond to from anywhere.

name: sv_max_queries_window
desc: Window over which to average queries per second averages.

name: sv_max_usercmd_move_magnitude
desc: Maximum move magnitude that can be requested by client.

name: sv_maxcmdrate
desc: (If sv_mincmdrate is > 0), this sets the maximum value for cl_cmdrate.

name: sv_maxrate
desc: Max bandwidth rate allowed on server, 0 == unlimited

name: sv_maxreplay
desc: Maximum replay time in seconds

name: sv_maxroutable
desc: Server upper bound on net_maxroutable that a client can use.

name: sv_maxupdaterate
desc: Maximum updates per second that the server will allow

name: sv_maxuptimelimit
desc: If set, whenever a game ends, if the server uptime exceeds this number of hours, the server will exit.

name: sv_maxusrcmdprocessticks
desc: Maximum number of client-issued usrcmd ticks that can be replayed in packet loss conditions, 0 to allow no restrictions

name: sv_maxusrcmdprocessticks_holdaim
desc: Hold client aim for multiple server sim ticks when client-issued usrcmd contains multiple actions (0: off; 1: hold this server tick; 2+: hold multiple ticks)

name: sv_maxusrcmdprocessticks_warning
desc: Print a warning when user commands get dropped due to insufficient usrcmd ticks allocated, number of seconds to throttle, negative disabled

name: sv_memlimit
desc: If set, whenever a game ends, if the total memory used by the server is greater than this # of megabytes, the server will exit.

name: sv_mincmdrate
desc: This sets the minimum value for cl_cmdrate. 0 == unlimited.

name: sv_minrate
desc: Min bandwidth rate allowed on server, 0 == unlimited

name: sv_minupdaterate
desc: Minimum updates per second that the server will allow

name: sv_minuptimelimit
desc: If set, whenever a game ends, if the server uptime is less than this number of hours, the server will continue running regardless of sv_memlimit.

name: sv_motd_unload_on_dismissal
desc: If enabled, the MOTD contents will be unloaded when the player closes the MOTD.

name: sv_mumble_positionalaudio
desc: Allows players using Mumble to have support for positional audio.

name: sv_namechange_cooldown_seconds
desc: When a client name change is received, wait N seconds before allowing another name change

name: sv_netspike
desc: Write network trace if amount of data sent to client exceeds N bytes.  Use zero to disable tracing. Note that having this enabled, even if never triggered, impacts performance.  Set to zero when not in use. For compatibility reasons, this command can be initialized on the command line with the -netspike option.

name: sv_netspike_on_reliable_snapshot_overflow
desc: If nonzero, the server will dump a netspike trace if a client is dropped due to reliable snapshot overflow

name: sv_netspike_output
desc: Where the netspike data be written?  Sum of the following values: 1=netspike.txt, 2=ordinary server log

name: sv_netspike_sendtime_ms
desc: If nonzero, the server will dump a netspike trace if it takes more than N ms to prepare a snapshot to a single client.  This feature does take some CPU cycles, so it should be left off when not in use.

name: sv_noclipduringpause
desc: If cheats are enabled, then you can noclip with the game paused (for doing screenshots, etc.).

name: sv_npc_talker_maxdist
desc: NPCs over this distance from the player won't attempt to speak.

name: sv_password
desc: Server password for entry into multiplayer games

name: sv_pausable
desc: Is the server pausable.

name: sv_player_display_usercommand_errors
desc: 1 = Display warning when command values are out-of-range. 2 = Spew invalid ranges.

name: sv_player_usercommand_timeout
desc: After this many seconds without a usercommand from a player, the server will RunNullCommand as if client sends an empty command.

name: sv_playerperfhistorycount
desc: Number of samples to maintain in player perf history

name: sv_precacheinfo
desc: Show precache info.

name: sv_pure
desc: Show user data.

name: sv_pure_consensus
desc: Minimum number of file hashes to agree to form a consensus.

name: sv_pure_kick_clients
desc: If set to 1, the server will kick clients with mismatching files. Otherwise, it will issue a warning to the client.

name: sv_pure_retiretime
desc: Seconds of server idle time to flush the sv_pure file hash cache.

name: sv_pure_trace
desc: If set to 1, the server will print a message whenever a client is verifying a CRC for a file.

name: sv_pvsskipanimation
desc: Skips SetupBones when npc's are outside the PVS

name: sv_querycache_stats
desc: Display status of the query cache (client only)

name: sv_quota_stringcmdspersecond
desc: How many string commands per second clients are allowed to submit, 0 to disallow all string commands

name: sv_rcon_banpenalty
desc: Number of minutes to ban users who fail rcon authentication

name: sv_rcon_log
desc: Enable/disable rcon logging.

name: sv_rcon_maxfailures
desc: Max number of times a user can fail rcon authentication before being banned

name: sv_rcon_maxpacketbans
desc: Ban IPs for sending RCON packets exceeding the value specified in sv_rcon_maxpacketsize

name: sv_rcon_maxpacketsize
desc: The maximum number of bytes to allow in a command packet

name: sv_rcon_minfailures
desc: Number of times a user can fail rcon authentication in sv_rcon_minfailuretime before being banned

name: sv_rcon_minfailuretime
desc: Number of seconds to track failed rcon authentications

name: sv_rcon_whitelist_address
desc: When set, rcon failed authentications will never ban this address, e.g. '127.0.0.1'

name: sv_region
desc: The region of the world to report this server in.

name: sv_restrict_aspect_ratio_fov
desc: This can be used to limit the effective FOV of users using wide-screen resolutions with aspect ratios wider than 1.85:1 (slightly wider than 16:9).     0 = do not cap effective FOV     1 = limit the effective FOV on windowed mode users using resolutions         greater than 1.85:1     2 = limit the effective FOV on both windowed mode and full-screen users

name: sv_setsteamaccount
desc: token Set game server account token to use for logging in to a persistent game server account

name: sv_showladders
desc: Show bbox and dismount points for all ladders (must be set before level load.)

name: sv_showlagcompensation
desc: Show lag compensated hitboxes whenever a player is lag compensated.

name: sv_shutdown
desc: Sets the server to shutdown next time it's empty

name: sv_shutdown_cancel
desc: Cancels pending sv_shutdown command

name: sv_shutdown_timeout_minutes
desc: If sv_shutdown is pending, wait at most N minutes for server to drain before forcing shutdown.

name: sv_signon_dos_disconnect
desc: Number of extra signon state confirmations required to disconnect a misbehaving client.

name: sv_skyname
desc: Current name of the skybox texture

name: sv_soundemitter_trace
desc: Show all EmitSound calls including their symbolic name and the actual wave file they resolved to

name: sv_stats
desc: Collect CPU usage stats

name: sv_steamblockingcheck
desc: Check each new player for Steam blocking compatibility, 1 = message only, 2 >= drop if any member of owning clan blocks,3 >= drop if any player has blocked, 4 >= drop if player has blocked anyone on server

name: sv_steamgroup
desc: The ID of the steam group that this server belongs to. You can find your group's ID on the admin profile page in the steam community.

name: sv_strict_notarget
desc: If set, notarget will cause entities to never think they are in the pvs

name: sv_tags
desc: Server tags. Used to provide extra information to clients when they're browsing for servers. Separate tags with a comma.

name: sv_test_scripted_sequences
desc: Tests for scripted sequences that are embedded in the world. Run through your map with this set to check for NPCs falling through the world.

name: sv_thinktimecheck
desc: Check for thinktimes all on same timestamp.

name: sv_timeout
desc: After this many seconds without a message from a client, the client is dropped

name: sv_turbophysics
desc: Turns on turbo physics

name: sv_unlockedchapters
desc: Highest unlocked game chapter.

name: sv_usercmd_custom_random_seed
desc: When enabled server will populate an additional random seed independent of the client

name: sv_visiblemaxplayers
desc: Overrides the max players reported to prospective clients

name: sv_voicecodec
desc: Specifies which voice codec to use. Valid options are: vaudio_speex - Legacy Speex codec (lowest quality) vaudio_celt - Newer CELT codec (22kHz, 22kbps) vaudio_celt_high - Newer CELT codec, higher bitrate (44kHz, 44kbps) steam - Use Steam voice API

name: sv_vote_allow_spectators
desc: Allow spectators to vote?

name: sv_vote_creation_timer
desc: How long before a player can attempt to call another vote (in seconds).

name: sv_vote_failure_timer
desc: A vote that fails cannot be re-submitted for this long

name: sv_vote_failure_timer_mvm
desc: A vote that fails in MvM cannot be re-submitted for this long

name: sv_vote_holder_may_vote_no
desc: 1 = Vote caller is not forced to vote yes on yes/no votes.

name: sv_vote_issue_autobalance_allowed
desc: Can players call votes to enable or disable auto team balance?

name: sv_vote_issue_autobalance_cooldown
desc: Minimum time before another auto team balance vote can occur (in seconds).

name: sv_vote_issue_changelevel_allowed
desc: Can players call votes to change levels?

name: sv_vote_issue_changelevel_allowed_mvm
desc: Can players call votes to change levels in MvM?

name: sv_vote_issue_classlimits_allowed
desc: Can players call votes to enable or disable per-class limits?

name: sv_vote_issue_classlimits_allowed_mvm
desc: Can players call votes in Mann-Vs-Machine to enable or disable per-class limits?

name: sv_vote_issue_classlimits_cooldown
desc: Minimum time before another classlimits vote can occur (in seconds).

name: sv_vote_issue_classlimits_max
desc: Maximum number of players (per-team) that can be any one class.

name: sv_vote_issue_classlimits_max_mvm
desc: Maximum number of players (per-team) that can be any one class.

name: sv_vote_issue_extendlevel_allowed
desc: Can players call votes to set the next level?

name: sv_vote_issue_extendlevel_quorum
desc: What is the ratio of voters needed to reach quorum?

name: sv_vote_issue_kick_allowed
desc: Can players call votes to kick players from the server?

name: sv_vote_issue_kick_allowed_mvm
desc: Can players call votes to kick players from the server in MvM?

name: sv_vote_issue_kick_min_connect_time_mvm
desc: How long a player must be connected before they can be kicked (in seconds).

name: sv_vote_issue_kick_namelock_duration
desc: How long to prevent kick targets from changing their name (in seconds).

name: sv_vote_issue_kick_spectators_mvm
desc: Allow players to kick spectators in MvM.

name: sv_vote_issue_mvm_challenge_allowed
desc: Can players call votes to set the challenge level?

name: sv_vote_issue_nextlevel_allowed
desc: Can players call votes to set the next level?

name: sv_vote_issue_nextlevel_allowextend
desc: Allow players to extend the current map?

name: sv_vote_issue_nextlevel_choicesmode
desc: Present players with a list of lowest playtime maps to choose from?

name: sv_vote_issue_nextlevel_prevent_change
desc: Not allowed to vote for a nextlevel if one has already been set.

name: sv_vote_issue_restart_game_allowed
desc: Can players call votes to restart the game?

name: sv_vote_issue_restart_game_allowed_mvm
desc: Can players call votes to restart the game in Mann-Vs-Machine?

name: sv_vote_issue_restart_game_cooldown
desc: Minimum time before another restart vote can occur (in seconds).

name: sv_vote_issue_scramble_teams_allowed
desc: Can players call votes to scramble the teams?

name: sv_vote_issue_scramble_teams_cooldown

name: tf_airblast_cray

name: tf_airblast_cray_debug
desc: Enable debugging overlays & output for cray airblast.  Value is length of time to show debug overlays in seconds.

name: tf_airblast_cray_ground_minz
desc: If set, cray airblast ensures the target has this minimum Z velocity after reflections and impulse have been applied. Set to 268.3281572999747 for exact old airblast Z behavior.

name: tf_airblast_cray_ground_reflect
desc: If set, cray airblast reflects any airblast power directed into the ground off of it, to prevent ground-stuck and provide a bit more control over up-vs-forward vectoring

name: tf_airblast_cray_lose_footing_duration
desc: How long the player should be unable to regain their footing after being airblast, separate from air-control stun.

name: tf_airblast_cray_pitch_control
desc: If set, allow controlling the pitch of the airblast, in addition to the yaw.

name: tf_airblast_cray_power
desc: Amount of force cray airblast should apply unconditionally. Set to 0 to only perform player momentum reflection.

name: tf_airblast_cray_power_relative
desc: If set, the blast power power also inherits from the blast's forward momentum.

name: tf_airblast_cray_reflect_coeff
desc: The coefficient of reflective power cray airblast employs.  0   - No reflective powers  0-1 - Cancel out some/all incoming velocity  1-2 - Reflect some/all incoming velocity outwards  2+  - Reflect incoming velocity outwards and then some

name: tf_airblast_cray_reflect_cost_coeff
desc: What portion of power used for reflection is removed from the push effect. Note that reflecting incoming momentum requires 2x the momentum - to first neutralize and then reverse it.  Setting this to 1 means that a target running towards the blast at more than 50% blast-speed would have a net pushback half that of a stationary target, since half the power was used to negate their incoming momentum. A value of 0.5 would mean that running towards the blast would not be beneficial vs being still, while values

name: tf_airblast_cray_reflect_relative
desc: If set, the relative, rather than absolute, target velocity is considered for reflection.

name: tf_airblast_cray_stun_amount
desc: Amount of control loss to apply if stun_duration is set.

name: tf_airblast_cray_stun_duration
desc: If set, apply this duration of stun when initially hit by an airblast.  Does not apply to repeated airblasts.
